row.Title: Director's Message
row.Author: J. Steven Landefeld
row.Description: Monthly message from BEA Director Steve Landefeld

row.Title: Taking Account
row.Description: BEA study compares disease-based indexes

row.Title: GDP and the Economy: Third Estimates for the Third Quarter of 2013
row.Author: Lisa S. Mataloni
row.Description: Real GDP rose 4.1 percent after rising 2.5 percent in the second quarter. Business investment as well as state and local government spending picked up, and imports slowed.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: Newly Available NIPA Tables
row.Description: These tables continue the presentation of estimates that reflect the 2013 comprehensive NIPA revision.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: Real Inventories, Sales, and Inventory-Sales Ratios for Manufacturing and Trade for the Third Quarter of 2013
row.Description: These statistics, including those for inventories for manufacturing by stage of fabrication, have been updated.
row.Category: National, Inventories, sales, and inventory-sales ratios for manufacturing and trade

row.Title: Territorial Economic Accounts for American Samoa, The Commonwealth of the Northern Mariana Islands, Guam, and the U.S. Virgin Islands
row.Author: Aya Hamano
row.Description: Updated economic estimates, including GDP for 2011–2012 and GDP by industry and compensation by industry for 2011.

row.Title: U.S. International Transactions: Third Quarter of 2013
row.Author: Sarah P. Scott
row.Description: The current-account deficit decreased $1.8 billion to $94.8 billion. In the financial account, net financial inflows increased $1.8 billion to $67.3 billion.

row.Title: U.S. International Investment Position at the End of the Third Quarter of 2013
row.Author: Elena L. Nguyen
row.Description: The position increased $289.5 billion to –$4,165.6 billion at the end of the third quarter, reflecting an increase of $621.5 billion in the value of U.S.-owned assets abroad and an increase of $332.1 billion in the value of foreign-owned assets in the United States.

row.Title: An Ownership-Based Framework of the U.S. Current Account for 2001–2012
row.Author: Thomas Anderson
row.Description: An annual supplement to the international accounts presents current-account statistics that combine cross-border trade with net receipts of affiliates of multinational companies.

row.Title: Regional Quarterly Report
row.Author: David G. Lenze
row.Description: In the third quarter of 2013, state personal income growth slowed in 25 states, picked up in 22 states, and was unchanged in 3 states and the District of Columbia. Growth ranged from 0.4 percent in New Mexico to 1.9 percent in Mississippi.

row.Title: Director's Message
row.Author: J. Steven Landefeld
row.Description: Monthly message from BEA Director Steve Landefeld

row.Title: Taking Account
row.Description: Health care spending growth sources

row.Title: GDP and the Economy: Advance Estimates for the Fourth Quarter of 2013
row.Author: Lisa S. Mataloni
row.Description: Real GDP increased 3.2 percent after increasing 4.1 percent in the third quarter. Business investment slowed, federal government spending decreased more than in the third quarter, and residential investment turned down. Consumer spending and exports picked up.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: Newly Available NIPA Tables
row.Description: These tables conclude the presentation of estimates that reflect the 2013 comprehensive NIPA revision.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: Industry Economic Accounts: Results of the Comprehensive Revision
row.Author: Donald D. Kim, Erich H. Strassner, David B. Wasshausen
row.Description: The revised statistics show that economic growth in 2012 was widespread; 20 of the 22 major industry groups contributed to the 2.8 percent increase in real GDP. Leading contributors were professional and business services; finance, insurance, real estate, rental, and leasing; mining; and manufacturing.

row.Title: Director's Message
row.Author: J. Steven Landefeld
row.Description: Monthly message from BEA Director Steve Landefeld

row.Title: Taking Account
row.Description: Taking Account: Guide to university impact studies and an FAQ on the health care act and personal income

row.Title: GDP and the Economy: Second Estimates for the Fourth Quarter of 2013
row.Author: Lisa S. Mataloni
row.Description: Real GDP increased 2.4 percent after increasing 4.1 percent in the third quarter. Inventory investment slowed, federal government spending decreased more than in the third quarter, and residential investment and state and local government spending turned down.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: Treatment of Research and Development in Economic Accounts and in Business Accounts
row.Author: Dylan G. Rassier
row.Description: A look at R&D expenditures under the System of National Accounts 2008 and under generally accepted accounting principles. In the former, R&D expenditures are treated as investment, while in the latter, they are immediately expensed.

row.Title: The Comprehensive Restructuring of the International Economic Accounts: Changes in Definitions, Classifications, and Presentations
row.Author: Maria Borga, Kristy L. Howell
row.Description: A look at the upcoming restructuring of these accounts, the most significant change since 1976. These changes are the result of a multiyear process to modernize the accounts and to bring them in closer alignment with international standards.

row.Title: Director's Message
row.Author: J. Steven Landefeld
row.Description: Monthly message from BEA Director Steve Landefeld

row.Title: Taking Account
row.Description: BEA paper looks at trade in services in input-output models

row.Title: GDP and the Economy: Third Estimates for the Fourth Quarter of 2013
row.Author: Lisa S. Mataloni
row.Description: Real GDP rose 2.6 percent in the fourth quarter, reflecting positive contributions from consumer spending, exports, and nonresidential fixed investment that were partly offset by negative contributions from federal government spending, residential fixed investment, and imports.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: Government Receipts and Expenditures: Fourth Quarter of 2013
row.Author: Keith P. Zipay
row.Description: Net government saving increased $193.4 billion to –$882.5 billion. Net federal government saving increased $197.9 billion to –$652.1 billion. Net state and local government saving decreased $4.3 billion to –$230.3 billion.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: NIPA Translation of the Fiscal Year 2015 Federal Budget
row.Author: Mark S. Ludwick, Andrea L. Cook
row.Description: BEA prepares federal government estimates that are based on the proposed budget of the U.S. government. This analysis is often used to gauge the effects of the federal budget on U.S. economic activity.
row.Category: National, NIPA translation of the federal budget

row.Title: Real Inventories, Sales, and Inventory-Sales Ratios for Manufacturing and Trade for the Fourth Quarter of 2013
row.Description: These statistics, including statistics on inventories for manufacturing by stage of fabrication, have been updated.
row.Category: National, Inventories, sales, and inventory-sales ratios for manufacturing and trade

row.Title: U.S. International Transactions: Fourth Quarter of 2013 and 2013
row.Author: Sarah P. Scott
row.Description: In the fourth quarter, the current-account deficit decreased $15.2 billion to $81.1 billion. In the financial account, net financial inflows increased $105.5 billion to $173.7 billion. In 2013, the current-account deficit decreased $61.1 billion to $379.3 billion.

row.Title: U.S. International Investment Position at the End of the Fourth Quarter of 2013 and 2013
row.Author: Elena L. Nguyen
row.Description: The position decreased $405.7 billion to –$4,577.5 billion at the end of the fourth quarter, reflecting an increase of $777.8 billion in the value of foreign-owned assets in the United States and an increase of $372.1 billion in the value of U.S.-owned assets abroad.

row.Title: The Supply Side of Health Care
row.Author: Jeffrey Werling, Sean Keehan, Douglas Nyhus, Stephen Heffler, Ronald Horst, Douglas Meade
row.Description: Economists at the Center for Medicare & Medicaid Services (CMS) and Inforum develop supply-side health care statistics, reconciling data from CMS and the Bureau of Economic Analysis.

row.Title: Regional Quarterly Report
row.Author: David G. Lenze
row.Description: In the fourth quarter of 2013, state personal income growth slowed in California, Texas, New York, Florida, and 27 smaller states but accelerated in 19 states. Growth slowed on average to 0.6 percent from 1.0 percent in the third quarter. In 2013, growth slowed in all states.

row.Title: Director's Message
row.Author: J. Steven Landefeld
row.Description: Monthly message from BEA Director Steve Landefeld

row.Title: Taking Account
GDP and the Economy: Advance Estimates for the First Quarter of 2014
row.Author: Lisa S. Mataloni
row.Description: Real GDP increased 0.1 percent after increasing 2.6 percent in the fourth quarter of 2013. The slowdown reflected downturns in exports and business investment, a larger decrease in inventory investment, and a slowdown in consumer spending.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)
row.Supp1_Title: Preview of the Upcoming Annual NIPA Revision

row.Title: New Quarterly Gross Domestic Product by Industry Statistics
row.Author: Erich H. Strassner, David B. Wasshausen
row.Description: The leading contributors to economic growth in the fourth quarter of 2013 were nondurable-goods manufacturing; professional, scientific, and technical services; and wholesale trade. Fifteen of twenty-two major industry groups contributed to the growth.

row.Title: Director's Message
row.Author: Brian C. Moyer

row.Title: Taking Account
row.Description: Paper looks at approaches for disease-based prices.

row.Title: GDP and the Economy: Second Estimates for the First Quarter of 2014
row.Author: Lisa S. Mataloni
row.Description: Real GDP decreased 0.1 percent after increasing 2.6 percent in the fourth quarter of 2013, partly reflecting a downturn in exports and a larger decrease in inventory investment.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: Government Receipts and Expenditures: First Quarter of 2014
row.Author: Keith P. Zipay
row.Description: Net government saving decreased $82.8 billion to –$966.2 billion. Net federal government saving decreased $75.9 billion to –$728.9 billion. Net state and local government saving decreased $7.0 billion to –$237.3 billion.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: Affordable Care Act Transactions in the National Income and Product Accounts
row.Author: Benjamin A. Mandel
row.Description: A discussion of the major provisions of this act and how related transactions are classified and measured in the NIPAs.

row.Title: Returns for Domestic Nonfinancial Business
row.Author: Robert J. Corea, Bonnie A. Retus
row.Description: Aggregate rates of return for nonfinancial corporations, industries, and selected industry groups as well as Q ratios. Domestic nonfinancial corporate returns leveled off in 2013 after increasing for the last 3 years.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: Gross Domestic Product and Gross Domestic Income: Revisions and Source Data
row.Author: Alyssa E. Holdren
row.Description: A look at the source data used to prepare successive vintages of gross domestic product and gross domestic income.

row.Title: U.S. Travel and Tourism Satellite Accounts for 2010–2013
row.Author: Steven L. Zemanek
row.Description: In 2013, travel and tourism increased 3.5 percent after increasing 2.3 percent in 2012.
row.Category: Industry, Travel and tourism satellite accounts

row.Title: Real Personal Income and Regional Price Parities for States and Metropolitan Areas, 2008–2012
row.Author: Bettina H. Aten, Eric B. Figueroa
row.Description: In 2012, the change in real personal income ranged from 12.7 percent in North Dakota to –2.3 percent in South Dakota. The change in per capita personal income in metropolitan areas ranged from 7.9 percent in Pine Bluff, AR, to –7.9 percent in Kennewick-Richland, WA.

row.Title: Subject Guide for January–June 2014
row.Description: A guide to the articles in these issues of the Survey.

row.Title: Director's Message
row.Author: Brian C. Moyer
row.Description: Monthly message from BEA Acting Director Brian C. Moyer

row.Title: Taking Account
row.Description: BEA economist's new take on health care demand.

row.Title: GDP and the Economy: Third Estimates for the First Quarter of 2014
row.Author: Lisa S. Mataloni
row.Description: Real GDP decreased 2.9 percent after increasing 2.6 percent in the fourth quarter of 2013, partly reflecting a downturn in exports and a larger decrease in inventory investment.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: Real Inventories, Sales, and Inventory-Sales Ratios for Manufacturing and Trade for the First Quarter of 2014
row.Description: These updated statistics, including those for inventories for manufacturing by state of fabrication, have been updated.
row.Category: National, Inventories, sales, and inventory-sales ratios for manufacturing and trade

row.Title: The U.S. Net International Investment Position at the End of the First Quarter of 2014, Year 2013, and Annual Revisions
row.Author: Elena L. Nguyen
row.Description: The net international investment position was –$5,383.0 billion at the end of 2013, compared with –$4,578.2 billion at the end of 2012. At the end of the first quarter of 2014, the net position was –$5,539.3 billion.

row.Title: Direct Investment Positions for 2013: Country and Industry Detail
row.Author: Marilyn Ibarra-Caton, Raymond J. Mataloni Jr.
row.Description: The U.S. direct investment abroad position grew 6.3 percent after growing 8.3 percent in 2012. The foreign direct investment in the United States position grew 6.1 percent after growing 7.1 percent.

row.Title: Comprehensive Restructuring and Annual Revision of the U.S. International Transactions Accounts
row.Author: Jeffrey R. Bogen, Mai-Chi Hoang, Kristy L. Howell, Erin M. Whitaker
row.Description: This year's annual revision introduced a new presentation of the international economic accounts, one that reflects changes in classifications and definitions to bring the accounts in line with international guidelines.

row.Title: U.S. International Transactions: First Quarter of 2014
row.Description: The current-account deficit increased $23.8 billion to $111.2 billion. In the financial account, net U.S. borrowing decreased $66.0 billion to $77.5 billion.

row.Title: International Transactions and Positions in Financial Derivatives Other Than Reserves
row.Description: Statistics on transactions in financial derivatives by type of contract and by area for 2011–2013 and for the first quarter of 2012 through the first quarter of 2014. Note: How BEA Aligns and Augments Source data From the U.S. Treasury Department for Inclusion in the International Transactions Accounts. The restructured tables and the note on how BEA aligns and augments source data from the U.S. Treasury Department for inclusion in the international transactions accounts will be released as soon as they are available. BEA expects the tables and the note to be released by the end of August. Data users who subscribe to e-mail notifications of releases of the international investment position or the U.S. international transactions accounts will receive a notification of this release.

row.Title: Comprehensive Revision of Gross Domestic Product by State: Advance Statistics for 2013 and Revised Statistics for 1997–2012
row.Author: John E. Broda, Robert P. Tate
row.Description: Real GDP increased in 49 states and all eight regions in 2013. North Dakota was the fastest growing state at 9.7 percent. The Rocky Mountain region was the fastest growing region at 4.1 percent.

row.Title: Regional Quarterly Report
row.Author: David G. Lenze
row.Description: Personal income picked up in the first quarter of 2014, averaging a 0.8 percent increase. The fastest growth was in Vermont, Washington, and West Virginia.

row.Title: Director's Message
row.Author: Brian C. Moyer
row.Description: Monthly message from BEA Acting Director Brian C. Moyer

row.Title: Taking Account
row.Description: BEA releases new guide to international accounts

row.Title: GDP and the Economy: Advance Estimates for the Second Quarter of 2014
row.Author: Marissa J. Crawford
row.Description: Real GDP increased 4.0 percent after decreasing 2.1 percent in the first quarter of 2014, primarily reflecting upturns in inventory investment and in exports and a pickup in consumer spending.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: The 2014 Annual Revision of the National Income and Product Accounts
row.Author: Stephanie H. McCulla, Alyssa E. Holdren, Shelly Smith
row.Description: Details of the annual revision, which incorporated newly available and revised source data and new methods and presentations.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: The Revisions to GDP, GDI, and Their Major Components
row.Author: Dennis J. Fixler, Ryan Greenaway-McGrevy, Bruce T. Grimm
row.Description: This analysis confirms that BEA's estimates provide an accurate picture of the economy, indicating among other things, whether growth was positive or negative or whether it was accelerating or decelerating.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: Integrated Industry-Level Production Account for the United States , Sources of the Ongoing U.S. Recovery
row.Author: Steven Rosenthal, Matthew Russell, Jon D. Samuels, Erich H. Strassner, Lisa Usher
row.Description: Presenting a new industry-level data set for 1998–2012 that will be useful for analyzing underlying trends in aggregate economic growth.

row.Title: Activities of U.S. Multinational Enterprises in 2012
row.Author: Raymond J. Mataloni Jr.
row.Description: The current value added of the U.S. multinational enterprises rose 2.0 percent in 2012 after rising 9.2 percent in 2011. Employment increased 1.1 percent after increasing 2.2 percent.

row.Title: Director's Message
row.Author: Brian C. Moyer
row.Description: Monthly message from BEA Acting Director Brian C. Moyer

row.Title: Taking Account
row.Description: BEA paper looks at import substitution and prices

row.Title: GDP and the Economy: Second Estimates for the Second Quarter of 2014
row.Author: Marissa J. Crawford
row.Description: Real GDP increased 4.2 percent after decreasing 2.1 percent in the first quarter of 2014, primarily reflecting upturns in inventory investment and in exports and pickups in consumer spending and in nonresidential investment.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs), International, Foreign direct investment in the United States

row.Title: Government Receipts and Expenditures: Second Quarter of 2014
row.Author: Mary L. Roy
row.Description: Net government saving decreased $15.1 billion to –$816.1 billion. Net federal government saving decreased $28.5 billion to –$588.6 billion. Net state and local government saving increased $13.4 billion to –$227.5 billion.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: Direct Investment for 2011–2013: Detailed Historical-Cost Positions and Related Financial Transactions and Income Flows
row.Author: Marilyn Ibarra-Caton
row.Description: Detailed statistics on direct investment positions and related financial transactions and income flows for U.S. direct investment abroad and for foreign direct investment in the United States.
row.Supp2_Title: Foreign Direct Investment in the United States Tables

row.Title: Multinational Enterprises and International Technology Transfer
row.Author: William J. Zeile
row.Description: A look at recent studies of the changes in international technology diffusion and production in response to increased patent protection.

row.Title: How BEA Aligns and Augments Source Data From the U.S. Treasury Department for Inclusion in the International Transactions Accounts
row.Description: The estimates of financial-account flows in these accounts, which are based on Treasury Department data, are adjusted to align the estimates with balance-of-payments concepts and to close gaps in coverage.

row.Title: Prototype Personal Consumption Expenditures by State for 1997–2012
row.Author: Christian Awuku-Budu, Ledia Guci, Christopher A. Lucas, Charles Ian Mead
row.Description: A close look at the prototype estimates of personal consumption expenditures by state, released in August 2014, and the methodology.
row.Category: Regional, Personal consumption expenditures by state

row.Title: Director's Message
row.Author: Brian C. Moyer
row.Description: Monthly message from BEA Director Brian C. Moyer

row.Title: Taking Account
row.Description: Geographic adjustments to a key poverty measure

row.Title: GDP and the Economy: Third Estimates for the Second Quarter of 2014
row.Author: Lisa S. Mataloni
row.Description: Real GDP increased 4.6 percent after decreasing 2.1 percent in the first quarter of 2014, mainly reflecting upturns in exports and in inventory investment and pickups in nonresidential investment and consumer spending.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: Fixed Assets and Consumer Durable Goods for 2002–2013
row.Author: Robert Kornfeld, Marlyn Rodriguez, Jennifer A. Bennett Mark A. Bailey, Michael T. Cusick, Michael D. Glenn, Nadia Sadée
row.Description: These statistics on the net stock of equipment and software, on business and government structures, and on consumer durable goods have been updated to reflect the 2014 annual NIPA revision.
row.Category: National, Fixed assets and consumer durable goods

row.Title: U.S. International Services: Trade in Services in 2013 and Services Supplied Through Affiliates in 2012
row.Author: Alexis N. Grimm, Charu S. Krishnan
row.Description: In 2013, the surplus on the trade in services was $225.3 billion. In 2012, the services supplied to foreign markets by foreign affiliates of U.S. multinational enterprises exceeded the services supplied to U.S. markets by the U.S. affiliates of foreign multinational enterprises.

row.Title: U.S. International Transactions: Second Quarter of 2014
row.Author: Sarah P. Scott
row.Description: The current-account deficit decreased $3.6 billion to $98.5 billion. In the financial account, net U.S. borrowing decreased $73.6 billion to $17.6 billion.

row.Title: The U.S. Net International Investment Position at the End of the Second Quarter of 2014
row.Author: Kyle L. Westmoreland
row.Description: The net international investment position was –$5,445.1 billion at the end of the second quarter of 2014, compared with –$5,511.7 billion at the end of the first quarter.

row.Title: Comprehensive Revision of Gross Domestic Product by Metropolitan Area: Advance Statistics for 2013 and Revised Statistics for 2001–2012
row.Author: Sharon D. Panek, Jacob R. Hinson, Frank T. Baumgardner
row.Description: Real GDP increased in 292 of the nation's 381 metropolitan areas in 2013. Real GDP for metropolitan areas in the United States increased 1.7 percent in 2013 after increasing 2.6 percent in 2012.
row.Category: Regional, Gross domestic product by metropolitan area

row.Title: Prototype Quarterly Gross Domestic Product by State Statistics for 2005-2013
row.Author: Lam Cao, Charles Ian Mead, Todd Siebeneck, Catherine (Zheng) Wang
row.Description: These new statistics provide a more complete picture of economic growth across states. In the fourth quarter of 2013, real GDP increased in all states except Mississippi and Minnesota.
row.Category: Regional, Gross domestic product by state

row.Title: Regional Quarterly Report
row.Author: David G. Lenze
row.Description: Personal income picked up in the second quarter of 2014. Growth accelerated in 36 states, ranging from 1.1 percent in New York and Alaska to 2.7 percent in North Dakota and Nebraska. Detailed annual statistics for 2013 are also discussed.

row.Title: Schedule of BEA News Releases in 2015
Director's Message
row.Author: Brian C. Moyer
row.Description: Monthly message from BEA Director Brian C. Moyer

row.Title: Taking Account
row.Description: A look at BEA's defined benefit pension approach

row.Title: GDP and the Economy: Advance Estimates for the Third Quarter of 2014
row.Author: Lisa S. Mataloni
row.Description: Real GDP increased 3.5 percent after increasing 4.6 percent in the second quarter. The slowdown mainly reflected a downturn in inventory investment and slowdowns in consumer spending, in nonresidential investment, and in exports.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: Updated Summary of NIPA Methodologies
row.Description: The data and methods used to prepare current-dollar and real gross domestic product and current-dollar gross domestic income, reflecting the 2014 annual NIPA revision.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: Measuring R&D in the National Economic Accounting System
row.Author: Marissa J. Crawford, Jennifer Lee, John E. Jankowski, Francisco A. Moris
row.Description: A discussion of the source data and methods used to account for research and development expenditures as investment in the national income and product accounts and the industry economic accounts.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs), Industry, Industry economic accounts

row.Title: Activities of U.S. Affiliates of Foreign Multinational Enterprises in 2012
row.Author: Thomas Anderson
row.Description: The current-dollar value added of majority-owned U.S. affiliates rose 3.7 percent to $773.8 billion. Employment by these affiliates increased 1.3 percent to 5.8 million workers.
row.Category: International, Foreign direct investment in the United States

row.Title: Director's Message
row.Author: Brian C. Moyer
row.Description: Monthly message from BEA Director Brian C. Moyer

row.Title: Taking Account
row.Description: BEA study looks at gross versus net labor shares

row.Title: GDP and the Economy: Second Estimates for the Third Quarter of 2014
row.Author: Lisa S. Mataloni
row.Description: Real GDP increased 3.9 percent after increasing 4.6 percent in the second quarter. The slowdown mainly reflected a downturn in inventory investment and slowdowns in exports, in nonresidential investment, and consumer spending.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: Government Receipts and Expenditures: Third Quarter of 2014
row.Author: Mary L. Roy
row.Description: Net government saving decreased $27.2 billion to –$852.9 billion. Net federal government saving decreased $22.5 billion to –$621.1 billion. Net state and local government saving decreased $4.7 billion to –$231.8 billion.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: Industry Economic Accounts: Initial Statistics for the Second Quarter of 2014 and Revised Statistics for 1997–2013 and the First Quarter of 2014
row.Author: Thomas F. Howells, Edward T. Morgan
row.Description: Economic growth was widespread in the second quarter of 2014; 19 of the 22 major industry groups contributed to the 4.6 percent growth in real GDP.

row.Title: Territorial Economic Accounts for American Samoa, the Commonwealth of the Northern Mariana Islands, Guam, and the U.S. Virgin Islands.
row.Author: Kevin Furlong, Aya Hamano
row.Description: Updated economic estimates, including new estimates of GDP for 2013 and of GDP by industry and compensation by industry for 2012 and revised estimates of GDP for 2010–2012.

row.Title: Local Area Personal Income for 2013
row.Author: David G. Lenze
row.Description: Personal income in the metropolitan portion of the United States grew 2.0 in 2013 and grew 2.1 percent in the nonmetropolitan portion.

row.Title: Subject Guide
row.Description: A list of the articles published in the Survey of Current Business in 2014.

row.Title: Schedule of BEA News Releases in 2015
